transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sorry, Future Man, but I've used my reverse polarity ray to spoil your plans.

transcript.speaker: Future Man
transcript.dialogue: Not so fast, Space Clown! My time-space manipulator has assembled an army of invisible cavemen to block your reverse polarity ray.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's a neat trick, Future Fool, but my frequency demodulator re-routed your cave creeps to the Victorian era, where they will be mocked for their ill manners and crude mode of dress.

transcript.speaker: Future Man
transcript.dialogue: That's unlucky. I suspect my future's not so bright after all.

transcript.speaker: Future Man
transcript.dialogue: That's all well and good, Space Dud, but I've saved the best for last! Take this! (nozzle begins to emit a cloud of gas)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (walking toward Future Man) (coughs) It seems to be (coughs) some kind of (coughs) gas.

transcript.speaker: Future Man
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) It is the ancient vapor of Kintavé, Space Goon. You will now be driven to feed off the flesh of humanoids to survive. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: (Original "Space Ghost" cartoon title screen and theme, titled
transcript.dialogue: "Space Ghost in The Curse of Kintavé")

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Greetings, I'm Space Ghost. My guests tonight include the symbol of man's epic struggle against a mysterious and complex universe, Moby! Plus, the very difficult to work into a show comic, Emo Philips!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, no, I, I put him my mouth and ate him.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Fff! Eh, I'm kiddin'. Richard had to go. He had an (belch voice) appointment. Eh, you know Richard.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, go grapple with your lever. Zorak, please play me to the desk, if you please.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk, makes long belch) Ooh, excuse me!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (scoots toward monitor) (to Moby) What do you want?

transcript.speaker: Moby
transcript.dialogue: Well, my name's Moby, and I'm from New York City, where are you from?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm from outer space, Moby. Home of the universe. (smile sparkles)

transcript.speaker: Moby
transcript.dialogue: Are there any trouble spots in the universe, right now, that you can talk about?

transcript.speaker: Moby
transcript.dialogue: What did you think about, what was it, the Shoemaker-Levy comet that crashed into Jupiter?

transcript.speaker: Moby
transcript.dialogue: The Shoemaker-Levy, it was, it was, uh, it was a three-stage comet that crashed into Jupiter.

transcript.speaker: Moby
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, and they'd said that if a comet like that hit...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Was that on a Tuesday? Because I think I had a guitar lesson that day.

transcript.speaker: Moby
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, but you would think something like that, that's like being a, a policeman, and...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Listen, I can't worry about every little snafu. I have celebrities to talk to! Like Moby!

transcript.speaker: Moby
transcript.dialogue: Celebrities, huh? So celebrities are more important than the safety and well-being of...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nobody cares, Moby. (beat) Nobody cares. (beat) No one.

transcript.speaker: Moby
transcript.dialogue: Are you sort of new to this interview process?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I've been doing this for thousands of years, Moby.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh! Well, thank you for the compliment.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, sometimes those are the best compliments of all.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'll tell ya, Moby, it sure hasn't felt like thousands of years. But I guess that's because on my planet, it's still only Tues-- Tuesday! My guitar lesson! (flies off)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (stares at his console, then leafs through a book)

transcript.speaker: Moby
transcript.dialogue: And what about this lava character?

transcript.speaker: Moby
transcript.dialogue: So, if you're such a, if you're such a nice benign upstanding...

transcript.speaker: Future Man
transcript.dialogue: (in Space Ghost's mind) Feed of the flesh of humanoids to survive!

transcript.speaker: Moby
transcript.dialogue: ... character, how come you surround yourself with so many miscreants?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sees everything red, hears Future Man's laughter) (stares at Moby's head) This guy's got a nice boney head.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I reckon that bucket's got some treats inside.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (bounds back to his desk, monitor is now empty) (smacks his lips) Moltar, send out another tender celebrity for me to interview.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Am I sure? Moltar, I think I'd know if I ate a guest, okay? Now, send him out here, it'll be alright.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (beat) Huh... (throws lever, title card appears on monitor:

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost Coast to CoastTWEENERSCUT 15"NOTHING GOIN ON"
Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Um... watch yourself out there. Space Ghost is acting kinda funny. (monitor momentarily shows Moltar watching the monitor)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You know what? Forget what I just said. Go out there and have fun with it. (throws lever, sending Emo to the studio monitor) Dead man walkin'. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Welcome to my show, Emo. How do you like deep space?

transcript.speaker: Emo Philips
transcript.dialogue: I like outer space. In outer space, no one can hear the audience scream.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Emo, you're uncommonly funny. Where do you get your humorous ideas?

transcript.speaker: Emo Philips
transcript.dialogue: I've found... You could often find humor, just by turning something upside down. Like a small child.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Once again, very witty, Emo. My compliments to you.

transcript.speaker: Emo Philips
transcript.dialogue: Zorak? Zorak, you're an intelligent being, do you like riddles?

transcript.speaker: Emo Philips
transcript.dialogue: What's green, obnoxious, plays the keyboard...

transcript.speaker: Emo Philips
transcript.dialogue: And... (flails his arms) Oh, forget it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (eyes turn red again) Eatmo, have you ever considered slathering yourself in hot honey mustard sauce?

transcript.speaker: Emo Philips
transcript.dialogue: ... as opposed to the breakfast you guys provided for me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I noticed you didn't finish your stuffing. I'm very disappointed.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why don't you finish it now? I left the bowl down by your, uh... (Emo looks down) That's a boy... And the butter, don't for-. There you go. (flies straight up, appears on monitor in front of Emo) Greetings, citizen! (Future Man's laughter in his mind)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (bounds back to his desk, monitor is again empty)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What's that... schmeg on your face?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (belches, Emo's voice says "Where is the restroom")

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well, I got somebody on stand-by, but... (throws lever, Shirley Manson appears in corner of monitor) ... I don't know...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Awright... (throws lever again, sends Shirley to studio monitor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (groans more, then eyes return to normal) Uh, do you have anyone thicker?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Haven't you had enough, Space Ghost? (throws lever, Shirley fades from monitor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'll tell you the problem. The problem is the crummy service in this place! (burps) I'm never eating here again! Come on, Zorak, we're leaving!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I can stop anytime I want.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Fine!! (sits quietly at his desk, taps his cards several times) (moans to himself) (taps cards faster and faster until they catch fire) Mmmm... (turns and looks at Zorak, as his eyes turn red again; more laughter from Future Man in his mind)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (still staring at Zorak) I'll need some tools...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I don't think I'd taste very good.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ah, you don't wanna do that.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I, I don't bathe, I carry many diseases, I, uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stands) Pinch the tail, suck the head, use the vest for a napkin, throw away the eyes. (flies over to Zorak's pod)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (emerging from Zorak's pod) Moltar... You're looking rather (belches) plump today.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (turns from monitor, clears throat) I'm outta here. (starts walking away)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to control room, Shirley looks on from monitor) (burps) Hold it, boy.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You don't want me. I'll burn the roof of your mouth.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Not if I blow on you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (leaps on Moltar, they struggle off camera as Shirley watches. He reappears holding Moltar) (to Shirley) You want some?

transcript.speaker: Shirley Manson
transcript.dialogue: No, I'm not into that kind of thing.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Suit yourself. (disappears off screen again with Moltar, with Future Man's laughter in his head)

transcript.speaker: Kirk the Storyteller
transcript.dialogue: Whoa! I just had the most horrible dream, in space!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (far away) Please bring me some juice.
